HowToPlay.Menu_00_050: [UE:Meta key="7e865afbf8d44b7d82e286f1557a99a6" Scale="1"/]What If You Get into Trouble?
HowToPlay.Content_02:
[UE:Meta key="f4b7a4c3b7dc49478218345fe060a857" Scale="1"/]Learn about all the different types of Pikmin
and their unique characteristics.
HowToPlay.Content_03:
[UE:Meta key="5259189b7a4b46ae889fd61282a57a65" Scale="1"/]This section serves as an introduction to the
skills [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] can learn.
HowToPlay.Content_00:
[UE:Meta key="5ef20e553a5841efb701d09a76e6f959" Scale="1"/]This section contains basic information necessary
for progressing through Story mode.
HowToPlay.Content_06:
[UE:Meta key="f916ad0f2a7d499d82ddb5522d72d1a9" Scale="1"/]Learn more about all the rules and tips used in
Dandori Challenges.
HowToPlay.Content_07:
[UE:Meta key="b3209026a6e94309b239b4f908dbf2f1" Scale="1"/]Familiarize yourself with all the rules, tips, and
items used in Dandori Battles.
HowToPlay.Content_08:
[UE:Meta key="891fa95873704681a345dd75e482b88a" Scale="1"/]Everything you need to know about the rules and
features unique to night expeditions can be found
right here.
HowToPlay.Content_09:
[UE:Meta key="5d0abedeacea4f6b8ab63c3fd3ca64d0" Scale="1"/]Relive [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Olimar"/]Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s shipwreck experience alongside
the brave adventurer himself.
HowToPlay.Content_04:
[UE:Meta key="c094a6500a0b4361bfd778cc49d0695a" Scale="1"/]Learn everything you need to know about the
Tablet and its many apps.
HowToPlay.Content_05:
[UE:Meta key="69fe69e59832427e9e3181774d2fe4f8" Scale="1"/]Review all the options and functionalities found 
in the Options menu.
HowToPlay.Content_01:
[UE:Meta key="65d3816c323f45e9a63edaaa739c2019" Scale="1"/]Review all the rules, tips, and items
in Co-op Mode.
HowToPlay.Content_02_000:
[UE:Meta key="a0758221a37c48809cfc41dc02948476" Scale="1"/]Strong and fire resistant, you can rely on these
Pikmin when battling creatures.
HowToPlay.Content_02_010:
[UE:Meta key="c64937a05492491c9337818cd18a8aa1" Scale="1"/]You can throw these electricity-loving Pikmin up
high or put them to work digging in the dirt.
HowToPlay.Content_02_020:
[UE:Meta key="dad221567b704463b73e8f654366f8a6" Scale="1"/]These Pikmin won't drown, so they're extremely
useful in areas with water!
HowToPlay.Content_02_030:
[UE:Meta key="4a67708e91514dbb95ef056e79f5c8b5" Scale="1"/]These tough Pikmin can break crystal nodules and
crystal walls. Plus, they won't be crushed when
stepped on, as long as the ground beneath them
is soft.
HowToPlay.Content_02_040:
[UE:Meta key="d447045c21034892a717415fb8d0d0e2" Scale="1"/]These Pikmin might not be strong, but their ability
to fly makes them handy to have around for
midair battles or carrying treasures through
the air.
HowToPlay.Content_02_050:
[UE:Meta key="b8d0887444c842878ed0f6cf47c2634a" Scale="1"/]Each of these slower Pikmin has the strength of
10 Pikmin! Their muscular density also helps them
resist wind and bubble-based attacks.
HowToPlay.Content_02_060:
[UE:Meta key="b24834fe54834310a8ca65c1534c9eca" Scale="1"/]These Pikmin move fast and carry a poison in
their bodies that inflicts damage when they're
eaten by creatures.
HowToPlay.Content_02_070:
[UE:Meta key="5d1753290d1441449a4130dbcfe0afae" Scale="1"/]With their extremely cold bodies, these Pikmin can
freeze creatures and the surface of water.
HowToPlay.Content_02_080:
[UE:Meta key="bd402bd48cf34773a06b9ad6392ea38f" Scale="1"/]These Pikmin are found during night expeditions.
They are strong against fire, water, electricity, ice,
and poison, but cannot be active in bright places.
HowToPlay.Content_02_081:
[UE:Meta key="fbcc1df89fd2458ab4b55ae5e945451a" Scale="1"/]To produce more Glow Pikmin, transport
glow pellets to a Lumiknoll. New Glow Pikmin
will glide directly to your squad. Their flowers
bloom over time without nectar.
HowToPlay.Content_02_082:
[UE:Meta key="5d983c29d2234471b623ed732461b99a" Scale="1"/]At the end of a night expedition, the number of
Glow Seeds you receive depends on how many
Glow Pikmin are left in your squad. Glow Seeds
can only be used at night or underground.
HowToPlay.Content_02_083:
[UE:Meta key="930283e12ebd4f879d93271c5f3ef198" Scale="1"/]Hold down [PictureFont:IconData key="FlashBang" scale="0.66"/] to combine the Glow Pikmin in your
squad into a ball of light called a Glowmob that can
temporarily stun creatures. After the attack is
used, Glow Pikmin will resume their regular form.
HowToPlay.Content_03_000:
[UE:Meta key="d016de9d19a749949419245bb4c99267" Scale="1"/]A steadfast companion who can provide support
by attacking creatures and carrying treasure
alongside Pikmin.
HowToPlay.Content_03_040:
[UE:Meta key="62186185fc934874aee9f043a47fac8f" Scale="1"/]Oatchi's Pup Drive increases anytime you rescue
a castaway. Use Oatchi's Pup Drive points to train
with the captain, who will teach [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] a variety
of new skills.
HowToPlay.Content_03_050:
[UE:Meta key="4512362c6fbf48cc8cd16733d565561b" Scale="1"/]This skill teaches your Rescue Pup to help with
tasks that require strength, like carrying treasure
and pushing boxes. Continue training to keep
increasing his strength.
HowToPlay.Content_03_055:
[UE:Meta key="247160113a7649b1a918eb83ed8a5c85" Scale="1"/]Teaching this skill to your Rescue Pup further
increases the strength boost he gets from Buff.
You can level up this skill with more training.
HowToPlay.Content_03_060:
[UE:Meta key="2847fcf5cd4442728888d273ef77408f" Scale="1"/]A skill that teaches your Rescue Pup to hold
treasure and defeated creatures in his mouth in
order to transport them. He alone can carry an
object that would take 100 Pikmin to transport.
HowToPlay.Content_03_070:
[UE:Meta key="d8c48c80c82a461798efd474122060e4" Scale="1"/]This is a bite attack that Rescue Pups can use
against creatures. Level up this skill with training
to increase damage.
HowToPlay.Content_03_075:
[UE:Meta key="fc2ccc369c60491eb60db2906abe6153" Scale="1"/]This skill teaches Rescue Pups an even stronger
Chomp attack and allows them to jump up to
attack creatures in higher places.
HowToPlay.Content_03_080:
[UE:Meta key="c123d1cf73bf4599976835a4be76889e" Scale="1"/]With this skill, Rescue Pups charge up their power
and rush forward, dealing damage to creatures in
their path. They can also use it to knock treasure
down from high places and break dirt walls.
HowToPlay.Content_03_085:
[UE:Meta key="72cbade101824c7c8160de85b74b1fef" Scale="1"/]Teaching this skill to your Rescue Pup shortens
the amount of time it takes to charge up power
and increases the strength of the rush, leaving
creatures stunned for longer periods of time.
HowToPlay.Content_03_090:
[UE:Meta key="76203282fbc4438dab5514bc51b0a89e" Scale="1"/]This skill allows [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] to swim. If you level up
the skill in your training, he'll be able to do more
things in the water as well.
HowToPlay.Content_03_100:
[UE:Meta key="4c9fc2e55e7b4ecb82c4b08514715f3e" Scale="1"/]This skill lets you hop onto [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s back and
move around that way. Press [PictureFont:IconData key="Jump" scale="0.66"/] while on his back
to instruct him to jump over smaller steps.
HowToPlay.Content_03_105:
[UE:Meta key="1f1d19a0fe6b44ab9e63cc37f53a0a24" Scale="1"/]This will teach your Rescue Pup to pluck Pikmin
right out of the ground. Level up this skill to
increase plucking speed.
HowToPlay.Content_03_110:
[UE:Meta key="e392975dd1d14d598c1f26810de7dd8e" Scale="1"/]A useful skill that allows your Rescue Pup to help
out when you need to dig in the dirt and sand or
speed up the Pikmin's excavations. Keep training
to increase his digging speed.
HowToPlay.Content_03_115:
[UE:Meta key="01e43702171047dc8a7469682fbaecdb" Scale="1"/]If [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] receives damage while exploring, this
skill helps him heal faster. Level up this skill to
keep increasing his healing speed.
HowToPlay.Content_03_120:
[UE:Meta key="5639825fff98470897fbf28ff4bc693d" Scale="1"/]This skill teaches [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] to track down different
things, as well as help with other tasks. Learn more
about what Commands are available in training.
HowToPlay.Content_00_000:
[UE:Meta key="8998beedba594b719cf227a579e8d2f0" Scale="1"/]Reunite with Rescue Corps Officers who crashed
on an unknown planet while you search for the
missing [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="CaptainOlimar"/]Captain Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]. Be sure to rescue any
other castaways you find along the way.
HowToPlay.Content_00_020:
[UE:Meta key="9a5812d402ac439fa534e47585f455cf" Scale="1"/]You can save up to three rescue files in Story
mode. You can also copy or delete save data on
the Rescue Database screen.
HowToPlay.Content_00_025:
[UE:Meta key="d5beeb83621b46a19b4142c8a0d85388" Scale="1"/]If you press [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_R_Button" scale="0.66"/] during a conversation, you can
view the conversation history as far back as the
previous 50 messages up to that point.
HowToPlay.Content_00_030:
[UE:Meta key="56a9a8d87e224e2cb164ec9ca6372666" Scale="1"/]Creatures will attack when they see you or even
sense your presence. Try to approach them from
a blind spot or from behind, for example, to avoid
taking damage.
HowToPlay.Content_00_040:
[UE:Meta key="7b3acedfc47345a89c5c5f677473de25" Scale="1"/]Each Pikmin type has an advantage when fighting
certain kinds of creatures. For example, Red
Pikmin are strong against fiery creatures. Use the
right Pikmin based on the enemy you're fighting.
HowToPlay.Content_00_050:
[UE:Meta key="526c1255a16041118ef84cef488738d7" Scale="1"/]If your Pikmin get into trouble fighting creatures,
blow your whistle with [PictureFont:IconData key="Whistle" scale="0.66"/][PictureFont:IconData key="Long_Press_Button" scale="0.66"/] to call for a retreat.
When you do this, Pikmin may even regain
consciousness or evade enemy attacks.
HowToPlay.Content_00_070:
[UE:Meta key="aa7e45803389453c9e33555626ce249d" Scale="1"/]When pellets or defeated creatures are carried to
an Onion, the Onion will produce more Pikmin. The
type of Pikmin produced will be the same as the
majority of those that did the carrying.
HowToPlay.Content_00_090:
[UE:Meta key="833d05c2473b495a9e061d7d2b9c17bc" Scale="1"/]You need raw material to build things such as
clay bridges and clay mounds, and to develop new
items and gear in the Lab. Make sure to collect
as much as you can during explorations.
HowToPlay.Content_00_100:
[UE:Meta key="90a918f2ce464d70916e0bbc77ddd9f1" Scale="1"/]If you visit the scientist at the Rescue Command
Post, he can make items for you in exchange for
raw material. Items can only be used once, so
don't be afraid to stock up.
HowToPlay.Content_00_105:
[UE:Meta key="e6540b43f14e451ca551543977d38e2a" Scale="1"/]Whenever the scientist at the Rescue Command
Post invents a new item, you can select the item
to receive a prototype and give it a one-time-only
test run.
HowToPlay.Content_00_120:
[UE:Meta key="21a27bda6de343769307b82da65a3cc1" Scale="1"/]If you visit the scientist at the Rescue Command
Post, he can make gear for you in exchange
for raw material. Unlike items, gear can be
used indefinitely.
HowToPlay.Content_00_140:
[UE:Meta key="477c3504610e48d38164a402bdfde40b" Scale="1"/]After you rescue a certain castaway, you'll be able
to view the Piklopedia. Each new creature will be
recorded there as you encounter them. You can
study their behavior, read notes, and more.
HowToPlay.Content_00_142:
[UE:Meta key="8496ea9627ad4aefbf85a7b9972ae290" Scale="1"/]Press [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_Double_Manual_PictureBook_ZR" scale="0.66"/] to practice fighting creatures in
Engage mode. Creatures defeated in this mode
will not count toward your in-game stats.
HowToPlay.Content_00_142_Yoko:
[UE:Meta key="694a4ee8fdf04e05b11fa4e1370e5e19" Scale="1"/]Use [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_Double_Manual_PictureBook_ZR" scale="0.66"/] to practice fighting creatures in
Engage mode. Creatures defeated in this mode
will not count toward your in-game stats.
HowToPlay.Content_00_144:
[UE:Meta key="fac7a7de958247a7a9617ec5f558df43" Scale="1"/]You can bring Pikmin with you into Engage mode
or withdraw them while there. Any Pikmin lost while
playing this mode will not affect the number of
Pikmin you have in the main game.
HowToPlay.Content_00_146:
[UE:Meta key="787073482a124d54815aae1580f758b3" Scale="1"/]You can use items from your pack while in
Observe mode and Engage mode. Items used
within the Piklopedia will not be lost.
HowToPlay.Content_00_148:
[UE:Meta key="50254907acac429d84189313337ca345" Scale="1"/]After rescuing a certain castaway, you'll be able
to view the Treasure Catalog. Each time you
collect a new treasure, an entry is logged there.
You can view treasure, read notes, and more.
HowToPlay.Content_00_150:
[UE:Meta key="60cc81f6068c42cfbb7f09eb7f531202" Scale="1"/]Treasure is grouped into different series. You'll
receive sparklium whenever you complete a full
treasure series.
HowToPlay.Content_00_151:
[UE:Meta key="a93fa38ec6fe47889f8b73eaa24ed29c" Scale="1"/]When you rescue a certain castaway, you'll be
able to speak to them and give yourself a
makeover, which allows you to change your
name and parts of your appearance.
HowToPlay.Content_00_155:
[UE:Meta key="957da7c0411d4ff0b5bd107c64a09ace" Scale="1"/]Time flows differently on the surface compared to
underground. No matter how much time you spend
in a cave, time will barely pass on the surface.
Explore underground without worrying about time.
HowToPlay.Content_00_156:
[UE:Meta key="f49391217b70427c8e0c8a8aabd7b468" Scale="1"/]When you go underground, you need to select
which Pikmin will accompany you. If you're having
trouble deciding, you can always press [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_X_Button" scale="0.66"/] to
autoselect the recommended Pikmin.
HowToPlay.Content_00_160:
[UE:Meta key="bc995fb77573406b8540678e3c9b440e" Scale="1"/]When you return to the surface and at the end of
a day, your exploration results are displayed. You
will see castaways rescued, treasure collected,
Pikmin lost and gained, and more.
HowToPlay.Content_00_175:
[UE:Meta key="b10dee9540704df0b391fed07933df9c" Scale="1"/]If you lose a lot of Pikmin or get stuck, you can
Rewind Time to resume your exploration from an
earlier moment. Just remember you will not be able
to move between the surface and underground.
HowToPlay.Content_00_180:
[UE:Meta key="efc6c4a9b76540f390de9d8fa3921552" Scale="1"/]At sunset, Pikmin who aren't close to an Onion or
in your squad won't climb into the Onion and will be
left on the surface. Pikmin that are left behind will
be eaten by creatures.
HowToPlay.Content_06_000:
[UE:Meta key="68c7fecada4b4d81882fa0d1417946b1" Scale="1"/]Use your Dandori skills to rack up points and earn
medals by collecting treasure and creatures within
the time limit. In Story mode, you can keep retrying
a challenge until you've claimed a medal.
HowToPlay.Content_06_020:
[UE:Meta key="737e6f0ae9d04fc99ca0c1b0d1a4674f" Scale="1"/]The number of stages you can play increases
as the story progresses. After earning a medal, if
you rescued a certain castaway, you can tackle
the stage again from the Rescue Command Post.
HowToPlay.Content_06_030:
[UE:Meta key="2bbc5e224c07444e884b6fe999d3dbb1" Scale="1"/]In Dandori Challenges, you can get commemorative
medals for achieving outstanding results. There
are four types of medals: platinum, gold, silver,
and bronze.
HowToPlay.Content_06_035:
[UE:Meta key="04c77d0560a340dbaef106e36f02e5e1" Scale="1"/]When taking on a Dandori Challenge within the
Rescue Command Post, you can use Overtime
to keep playing after the time is up until all
transportable objects have been collected.
HowToPlay.Content_06_036:
[UE:Meta key="b1c18963983f48d586b85da797b68e0e" Scale="1"/]Select End Dandori Challenge from Options
to end Overtime. Even if you successfully collect
everything during Overtime, those results won't
be reflected in your game records.
HowToPlay.Content_07_000:
[UE:Meta key="4b309380f1a6457999a6caf6d3df8107" Scale="1"/]Collect treasure, creatures, and more within
the time limit, and compete to see who can earn
the most points. You'll be able to command up to
50 Pikmin during these battles.
HowToPlay.Content_07_015:
[UE:Meta key="6afd14496b4d4c9ab8f069d46377ba64" Scale="1"/]More stages will unlock as you progress through
the story. After winning a battle, if you've rescued
a certain castaway, you can tackle the stage
again back at the Rescue Command Post.
HowToPlay.Content_07_020:
[UE:Meta key="6d00e26151bc4759afae32354d8e1880" Scale="1"/]Bonus Finds may be announced during certain
stages. If you collect an object that matches
what's shown in the center of the screen, you'll
earn a lot more points for that object.
HowToPlay.Content_07_025:
[UE:Meta key="b29f1d3baa504adf805dde2aeae61531" Scale="1"/]This treasure only appears in Dandori Battles.
You will need a lot of Pikmin to carry it, but if
you can collect it, you'll earn a lot of points.
HowToPlay.Content_07_030:
[UE:Meta key="bb6b9d13644a4a368f8bb1c2a7d7e9ed" Scale="1"/]If you acquire a Mystery Capsule, you will receive
a random item that can be used in that battle.
HowToPlay.Content_07_040:
[UE:Meta key="5b916d848e8142ed8e7952d47eb9c43d" Scale="1"/]Items acquired through Mystery Capsules can
help you or hurt your opponent. They can be used
to increase your Pikmin count, call down lightning
onto your opponent, or even drop rocks on them!
HowToPlay.Content_07_070:
[UE:Meta key="625f9a4a66b44dfe97b46f5ce95be3ef" Scale="1"/]Sneak Bombs appear after a set time has passed.
If you feed them to your opponent's Onion, it will
explode and release solid Dandorium. Collect all the
Dandorium you can to increase your score.
HowToPlay.Content_07_080:
[UE:Meta key="f7281f6713e344cbab4902e2d4894034" Scale="1"/]The split screen lets you keep track of what your
opponent is doing. It can help you figure out when
to use Mystery Capsule items or interfere with
your opponent's Pikmin during transportation.
HowToPlay.Content_07_090:
[UE:Meta key="76dccc5d29c54162b8b4c35e02d22537" Scale="1"/]The Dandori Battle mode is available on the title
screen. During battles, you compete using a split
screen, with P1 on the left and P2 or the CPU on
the right.
HowToPlay.Content_07_091:
[UE:Meta key="3ee23c3702894e4287738f1ef80a6c75" Scale="1"/]In Dandori Battle mode, P1 and P2 can each
choose the rules and difficulty levels that work
best for them. If P2 is the CPU, you can choose
for the CPU.
HowToPlay.Content_07_092:
[UE:Meta key="451e6f110c10472ab4457e7bd0398036" Scale="1"/]You can change up the Pikmin you want to use in
Dandori Battle mode, but P1 and P2 always have
to start with the same type.
HowToPlay.Content_07_093:
[UE:Meta key="100bbde166754c22b8633957c4fa83c1" Scale="1"/]In Dandori Battle mode, you're able to select which
character you want to play as. The more you
progress in Story mode, the more characters
become available.
HowToPlay.Content_08_000:
[UE:Meta key="f9ba3af22a2245d0a2676fc9bc2b895b" Scale="1"/]Night expeditions become available as you play
through Story mode. Gather glow pellets and
protect the Lumiknoll from creatures, all in an
effort to harvest the glow sap that cures leaflings.
HowToPlay.Content_08_020:
[UE:Meta key="2fba2a0ce73a4bb6a0c1114fe34be648" Scale="1"/]As you find more bases during daytime
exploration, you will increase the number of
locations that can be explored at night.
HowToPlay.Content_08_030:
[UE:Meta key="227acf65a1514fd6a6f971ef3584b9e1" Scale="1"/]Creatures will head toward the Lumiknoll's light.
If the Lumiknoll is attacked and destroyed, the
night expedition for that day will end.
HowToPlay.Content_08_040:
[UE:Meta key="9415b2faa1174f9f88c083291bbb52dd" Scale="1"/]These are found scattered around the area
and can be spat out by large creatures when
you defeat them.
HowToPlay.Content_08_050:
[UE:Meta key="4e088e3c8f6e451ba18e131c9ddb0973" Scale="1"/]A Tricknoll emits light when approached to lure in
creatures. If attacked, it can only withstand a
certain amount of damage before it's demolished.
HowToPlay.Content_08_055:
[UE:Meta key="80b260bcca30495c8e7258973eabb3d6" Scale="1"/]When you deliver glow pellets to a Lumiknoll or
Tricknoll, [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]Glow Pikmin [System:Color name="Default"]will emerge from the
Lumiknoll. Prioritize finding pellets that
are close by in order to save time.
HowToPlay.Content_08_060:
[UE:Meta key="21220915b1d34a6384d33d2149ceae67" Scale="1"/]You can only receive one glow sap from each
Lumiknoll. A single glow sap has enough medicinal
ingredients to cure one leafling.
HowToPlay.Content_09_000:
[UE:Meta key="c033fae1ad7040408215f4f71b365249" Scale="1"/]Relive [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Olimar"/]Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s time spent gathering parts of the
S.S. Dolphin, scattered after an unfortunate
accident. This feature becomes available after
you progress to a certain point in Story mode.
HowToPlay.Content_09_020:
[UE:Meta key="bffb982d57ee4faface37a2d02ebefa3" Scale="1"/]As you progress, you can always travel back in
time on this screen and choose your starting day.
If you start from a previous day, your progress
from that day on will be deleted.
HowToPlay.Content_09_030:
[UE:Meta key="9c391b216a324a40adc881996d36b2f7" Scale="1"/]When choosing an area to explore, you can go back
to the day selection screen using the button at
the bottom of the list. So, if you ever get stuck,
you can start again from a previous day.
HowToPlay.Content_04_000:
[UE:Meta key="9ed304c2e97f4a53aaa1d0958b99f71e" Scale="1"/]The Radar Map displays the area you're currently
exploring, and places on the map you've already
visited will be displayed brighter. Use this map to
see where treasure, Pikmin, and other things are.
HowToPlay.Content_04_005:
[UE:Meta key="de932306f14a441ba1ccaf8dc8ef64d3" Scale="1"/]Newly discovered caves and areas now accessible
after completing a task are marked on the Radar
Map with [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Later" scale="0.66"/] or [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Later_Pass" scale="0.66"/]. The marks serve as reminders
and will disappear when you reach that location.
HowToPlay.Content_04_010:
[UE:Meta key="47384d810f0545bab106601c1bc5db7f" Scale="1"/]Visit this app to see your main mission and side
mission progress. It's also a good place to figure
out what you need to do next.
HowToPlay.Content_04_013:
[UE:Meta key="652f9604e11843a5a014e26ed031a63a" Scale="1"/]Open the Main Missions tab to check for updates
on your current objectives. The list will be updated
as the story progresses.
HowToPlay.Content_04_016:
[UE:Meta key="70a9f55306db4f3aaf08e33beab456d2" Scale="1"/]If you talk to rescued castaways, sometimes
they'll have special requests for you. Fulfill
these side missions to earn rewards.
HowToPlay.Content_04_020:
[UE:Meta key="885658e7937340ba8ff42fb766336ebf" Scale="1"/]Use the Status Report to check various records,
like how much progress you've made in an area
and how many Pikmin you've gained or lost since
starting your explorations.
HowToPlay.Content_04_030:
[UE:Meta key="f02d85e69de5498c84330888f2350ab1" Scale="1"/]This is a register of the Rescue Officers you've
met and castaways you've rescued so far. Learn
about each character by viewing their ID badge, or
select one to pay them a visit.
HowToPlay.Content_04_040:
[UE:Meta key="46f452e9d8f148b8badb278080299040" Scale="1"/]See the gear that you and [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] have acquired
and skills that [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] has learned. You can also
view a brief explanation and video for each one.
HowToPlay.Content_04_050:
[UE:Meta key="be592de7efd344659d413db56a10d522" Scale="1"/]A collection of rescue lessons passed down by
former captains, along with documentation related
to the Shepherd family history. You can also find
the current captain's journal here.
HowToPlay.Content_04_060:
[UE:Meta key="86b5500e63714169beda7f511f4f020d" Scale="1"/]A place to peruse [Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="CaptainOlimar"/]Captain Olimar[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s Voyage Log.
Keep progressing through the story to collect
more Voyage Log entries and work on unlocking
the Voyage Log of a certain someone else.
HowToPlay.Content_04_070:
[UE:Meta key="dc0186caedb34695b71b2f2a429c1084" Scale="1"/]Here you can view the Message Log and review
various records, such as your total play time
since starting the game.
HowToPlay.Content_05_010: [UE:Meta key="87ecfc17f8bd4f218e9e93df84ddca46" Scale="1"/]Use this button to return to the title screen.
HowToPlay.Content_05_020:
[UE:Meta key="aad7a73f82b044f1b380d44430bda438" Scale="1"/]Select this option to play with two people. You
can switch to Co-op Mode at any time while
playing through the story.
HowToPlay.Content_05_030:
[UE:Meta key="faad1ab686c14e3cae5378116a51fc4f" Scale="1"/]Return to Single-Player Mode when only one
person will be playing.
HowToPlay.Content_05_035:
[UE:Meta key="51abac16444542358024a7739e39dcd2" Scale="1"/]You can set shortcuts in order to use equipped
items and gear immediately. Customize them
to your style of play.
HowToPlay.Content_05_040:
[UE:Meta key="a64f9912acf0466aa4b3c31b7329bd38" Scale="1"/]By using Rewind Time, you can resume the
exploration from a slightly earlier state. If you
get into trouble, sometimes it helps to start over.
HowToPlay.Content_05_050:
[UE:Meta key="2cb312dd8d874e07828dd7cc015c679b" Scale="1"/]You can advance time to sunset in an instant
and end the day's exploration. Use this when you
have nothing left in the area that you want to do.
HowToPlay.Content_05_060:
[UE:Meta key="9ab0b3e7bb48467e93bf71ce6407c294" Scale="1"/]You can advance time in Olimar's Shipwreck Tale
to sunset in an instant and end the day's
exploration. Use this when you have nothing
left in the area that you want to do.
HowToPlay.Content_05_070:
[UE:Meta key="3a9b34c8bbda4b88bf85b892e1e078dd" Scale="1"/]Choose this in a Dandori Battle when you want to
end the battle or pick a different stage midbattle.
HowToPlay.Content_05_080:
[UE:Meta key="9dc8972e92254f2fbe6db6e788b8aff2" Scale="1"/]Choose this in a Dandori Challenge when you want
to cancel the challenge or pick a different stage
midchallenge.
HowToPlay.Content_05_100:
[UE:Meta key="6342353d69db4b64899700dcfc6c2375" Scale="1"/]You can find more details on the controls here.
When playing in Co-op Mode, the different controls
will be explained here as well.
HowToPlay.Content_05_110:
[UE:Meta key="9e319bd4ac0b4279acac8685c0ab7e29" Scale="1"/]You can customize various settings to your taste,
such as camera controls, the Radar Map, drone
settings, and turn the Motion Controls feature
on or off.
HowToPlay.Content_01_000:
[UE:Meta key="f03b058757494b399e1ac24b5d0ed690" Scale="1"/]If you select Co-op Mode from the Options menu,
two players will be able to play through the story.
P2 supports P1 by using the Pebble Pitcher to
throw both pebbles and items when available.
HowToPlay.Content_01_010:
[UE:Meta key="d041dc61b2a5465aa420aa069c08a1a4" Scale="1"/]If the Pebble Pitcher disappears off-screen,
P2 can return it to center screen by pressing [PictureFont:IconData key="Variable_X_Button_2P" scale="0.66"/].
HowToPlay.Content_01_020:
[UE:Meta key="4a46b382a49448ad998a543dff6fbfc5" Scale="1"/]Earn Co-op Points by working together. P2 can
help P1 defeat creatures, break walls, transport
things, etc. When the Co-op Gauge by the Pebble
Pitcher is full, [System:Color name="Emphasis" ]P2 receives an item they can use[System:Color name="Default"].
HowToPlay.Content_01_025:
[UE:Meta key="d52a243789fe4dbf9fa4d19da0a5311f" Scale="1"/]Help out Pikmin by hitting the treasure or creature
they're carrying with pebbles to increase their
carrying speed for a short time.
HowToPlay.Content_01_050:
[UE:Meta key="4b1f8c37ce9c4791a523cd9b8d4bc524" Scale="1"/]Items acquired by collecting Co-op Points will
disappear when Co-op Mode ends. They will not
be carried over the next time you play.
HowToPlay.StoryItem00:
[UE:Meta key="53d971f0f62f491682b631894027ff13" Scale="1"/][PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] loves his Scrummy Bones! They
restore his HP or, when it's full, temporarily
increase his max HP up to five times.
HowToPlay.StoryItem01:
[UE:Meta key="21618f73e9434a4abcbe264e65afc234" Scale="1"/]If this kit is in your pack when you get
knocked out, it will automatically restore your
HP and make you invincible for a short time.
HowToPlay.StoryItem02:
[UE:Meta key="bb6ac309df824805b9825de9139b9957" Scale="1"/]Creatures love to snap these Pikpik Carrots
right up! And the more they eat, the longer
the carrots' paralyzing effects will last.
HowToPlay.StoryItem03:
[UE:Meta key="32005afc04034aa2b8d2621bb33a4e5d" Scale="1"/]Ultra-Spicy Spray speeds up the Pikmin and
[PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/]'s movements. When used, anyone in
the area will be affected for a limited time.
HowToPlay.StoryItem04:
[UE:Meta key="946a0014b23e4a9b9bbb88a5e660c011" Scale="1"/]A Lightning Shock will call down lightning onto
creatures and briefly paralyze them with a
powerful electric shock.
HowToPlay.StoryItem05:
[UE:Meta key="c1712aa1227e4cfa8f91fd6524b53b53" Scale="1"/]The Bomb Rock is a rock that explodes when
thrown. Use it to break reinforced walls or
inflict damage on creatures.
HowToPlay.StoryItem06:
[UE:Meta key="d6f791a01ec14fc4815a51c7ad64fc67" Scale="1"/]The Mine automatically activates when it
detects signs of life. Plus, it sticks to any
creature it touches.
HowToPlay.StoryItem07:
[UE:Meta key="0f8d70acd77d4dc9aabacad7158bc54d" Scale="1"/]The Trackonator automatically chases after
its prey once found. If there are no targets
in the vicinity, it will explode on the spot.
HowToPlay.StoryItem08:
[UE:Meta key="633ef023744045279b730aec97f3717d" Scale="1"/]The Ice Blast freezes any and all targets
caught in its ice-cold blast zone.
HowToPlay.StoryItem09:
[UE:Meta key="fdc85f17afc749b08f6ac5810cbd61e7" Scale="1"/]The Survey Drone scouts the area from the
skies above. You can use it to place up to
three pins on places of interest.
HowToPlay.StoryItem10:
[UE:Meta key="65720ee38aa94771b2693a2ed06d751b" Scale="1"/]This device gathers Pikmin currently outside
your squad back at the base. It will also
affect Pikmin who are busy with tasks.
HowToPlay.StoryItem11:
[UE:Meta key="260d1f73cc8f48d18f90d414f883b6f8" Scale="1"/]Releases an alert that calls Pikmin currently
outside your squad back to you but will have
no effect on Pikmin who are busy with a task.
HowToPlay.StoryItem12:
[UE:Meta key="3e2121278ba445779b5169d8c7ef765c" Scale="1"/]This powerful horn signals to [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] or the
selected Pikmin in your squad to charge.
HowToPlay.StoryItem13:
[UE:Meta key="9009b95dfefb4b80ae7873292bef7b79" Scale="1"/]The Idle Counter keeps a tally of the number
of Pikmin currently outside your squad, not
including those busy with a task.
HowToPlay.StoryItem14:
[UE:Meta key="2aad1daaaf0d4a74a756d175d37ee8d4" Scale="1"/]This sensor reacts to treasure, castaways,
and more when you approach them. The
closer you are, the stronger the signal.
HowToPlay.StoryItem15:
[UE:Meta key="9a63129d3997448bbb9df844cb86c5ff" Scale="1"/]An upgraded Treasure Gauge that can detect
the number of treasures in an area or cave.
HowToPlay.DDBItem00:
[UE:Meta key="7a2809e6ae714c718c7e0a0c291859dc" Scale="1"/]Use a Quick Pik to add [Carrot:PikminBirthNum/] Pikmin
to your squad.
HowToPlay.DDBItem01:
[UE:Meta key="c9acc34673dd47829973734f1112ce8d" Scale="1"/]The Quick Glow Pik adds [Carrot:PhotonPikminBirthNum/] Glow Pikmin
to your squad.
HowToPlay.DDBItem02:
[UE:Meta key="7bd1b9300797405095c130f5f5147d0d" Scale="1"/]Ultra-Spicy Spray speeds up the Pikmin or
your pup partner's movements. Anyone in
the area will be affected for a limited time.
HowToPlay.DDBItem03:
[UE:Meta key="ab41bde9f43e4b2b9ed0f1fa261696f5" Scale="1"/]Use a Lightning Shock to paralyze your
opponent, their pup partner, their Pikmin, or
even creatures with an electric shock.
HowToPlay.DDBItem04:
[UE:Meta key="a9b1d3ff02654cfdad9126d81b5b2ee5" Scale="1"/]Use the Rock Storm to drop rocks on your
battle opponent and inflict some damage.
HowToPlay.DDBItem05:
[UE:Meta key="acf77d4a6e0240018ab820a576ca2039" Scale="1"/]The Bewilder Bomb surrounds your opponent
with black smoke. Their character will be
blown away, and their Pikmin will panic!
HowToPlay.DDBItem06:
[UE:Meta key="c973961ba9994eaca7c8098e02e63cb6" Scale="1"/]The Trackonator automatically chases after
its prey once found. If there are no targets
in the vicinity, it will explode on the spot.
HowToPlay.DDBItem07:
[UE:Meta key="b193fb976cb04863b77a008d326f56ca" Scale="1"/]The Mine automatically activates when it
detects signs of life. Plus, it sticks to any
creature it touches.
HowToPlay.DDBItem08:
[UE:Meta key="eec4f8c1483b43698f478002f55409c4" Scale="1"/]Use a Warp to forcibly move your opponent
to a different location.
HowToPlay.CoopItem01:
[UE:Meta key="3faf42674a7f4534b16f57bd781005fe" Scale="1"/]When you give nectar to a Pikmin, they bloom
a flower. Give it to [PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/][Npc:EmphasisStart NpcName="Happy"/]Oatchi[Npc:EmphasisEnd/] when his HP is
low, and he will recover a small amount of HP.
HowToPlay.CoopItem02:
[UE:Meta key="5dd8775524ea445abc3639cf451dc2a7" Scale="1"/][PictureFont:IconData key="Icon_Happy_Blue" scale="0.66"/]Oatchi loves his Scrummy Bones! They
restore his HP or, when it's full, temporarily
increase his max HP up to five times.
HowToPlay.CoopItem03:
[UE:Meta key="2e4315d1623f44239ec0c7fdce86e6d7" Scale="1"/][Grammar:Cap/]creatures love to snap these Pikpik Carrots
right up! And the more they eat, the longer
the carrots' paralyzing effects will last.
HowToPlay.CoopItem04:
[UE:Meta key="fe6f5d63b8c94a11a9a766d23336d594" Scale="1"/]The Bomb Rock is a rock that explodes when
thrown. Use it to break reinforced walls or
inflict damage on creatures.
HowToPlay.CoopItem05:
[UE:Meta key="70a31751a9614ed7a305e4b04ef74d3b" Scale="1"/]The Ice Blast freezes any and all targets
caught in its ice-cold blast zone.
HowToPlay.CoopItem06:
[UE:Meta key="c059824233b3477c96fedb20e2a1e907" Scale="1"/]A Lightning Shock will call down lightning onto
creatures and briefly paralyze them with a
powerful electric shock.
